edu.wm.cs.cs301.cullenrombach.falstad

Class Maze

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wm.cs.cs301.cullenrombach.falstad.Maze

  • public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
    Class handles the user interaction for the maze. It implements a state-dependent behavior that controls the display and reacts to key board input from a user. After refactoring the original code from an applet into a wrapper, it is wrapped by a MazeApplication to be a java application and a MazeApp to be an applet for a web browser. At this point user keyboard input is first dealt with a key listener and then handed over to a Maze object by way of the keyDown method. This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Method to initialize internal attributes. Called separately from the constructor.

      • build

        public void build(int skill)
        Method obtains a new Mazebuilder and has it compute new maze, it is only used in keyDown()
        Parameters:
        skill - level determines the width, height and number of rooms for the new maze

      • newMaze

        public void newMaze(BSPNode root,
                    Cells c,
                    Distance dists,
                    int startx,
                    int starty)
        Call back method for MazeBuilder to communicate newly generated maze as reaction to a call to build()
        Parameters:
        root - node for traversals, used for the first person perspective
        cells - encodes the maze with its walls and border
        dists - encodes the solution by providing distances to the exit for each position in the maze
        startx - current position, x coordinate
        starty - current position, y coordinate

      • setDriverType

        public void setDriverType(java.lang.String type)
        Sets this Maze's driverType field to the given value, or to "ManualDriver" if it's not an accepted robot type.
        Parameters:
        type -
